cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SSE of Cape Hatteras North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north then accelerate north-northeast toward southern New England, passing east of the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England (Long Island-Rhode Island area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge watches extend from Fire Island Inlet NY eastward across Long Island, Connecticut and Massachusetts, including Nantucket, Martha’s Vineyard and Block Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Long Island, southern and eastern New England coastline, portions of New Jersey shore
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤18%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25-35 mph possible Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft tidal surge possible along lower Delaware River and New Jersey coast, but less than 3 ft at the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday with localized heavier downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas on approaches; minor river/urban flooding possible during heaviest rain
